intro: Boehmeria platyphylla var. ugandensis, commonly known as the Uganda flatleaf nettle, is a flowering plant species native to East Africa. It belongs to the Urticaceae family, which includes various species of nettle plants. The plant is characterized by its broad, flat leaves and stinging hairs on its stems and leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and swampy areas. The plant has been used traditionally for its fibrous stems, which are utilized in making textiles and paper.
